news_header: US stock markets rose on Monday following Trump's announcement of new import duties on aluminium and steel.
news_text: On Monday, US stock markets opened higher with the S&P 500 up by 0.4%, Nasdaq by 0.7%, and Dow Jones by 0.2%. This rise followed President Trump's announcement of a 25% import duty on aluminium and steel. Companies like U.S. Steel, Nucor, Cleveland-Cliffs, and Alcoa saw significant gains. Additionally, McDonald's reported its fourth-quarter earnings, exceeding analysts' expectations. This week, inflation figures and the producer price index will be closely watched.
